result.execSummary:
The defendant Phillip John Metcalf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of probation: Costs $ 243.00,   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge.

miscConds.notes: Costs $ 243.00 plus DNA Surcharge of $200.00  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable surcharge.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court with attorney Christian J Ness.  Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in custody.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  16 CT 91, 15 CM 296 and 16 CM 122.  State recites his recommendation - Atty Ness makes recommendations.  DE addressed the Court.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 12, 2017 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts
State requests to amend charge to Disorderly Conduct.
DEF pleads NC to amended charge.
Court finds DEF has made plea, willingly, freely and intelligently.
Court accepts plea, finds guilty to amended chage of disorderly conduct. 
ADA Marcoux argues sentence. Atty McLaughlin argues sentence.
Court withholds sentence, imposes 2 years probation, complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Def. must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $ 200 surcharge. plus court costs of $ 243.00. Probation to be served concurrent with 16CM122 and 16CT91.   Def. to report to Probation & Parole today.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court with attorney James C. McLaughlin.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
 Atty McLaughlin: just informed DEF has more citations, wishes to be set for scheduling after intake on those.


  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Bail continues Motions to be filed by 3/1/16  Jury trial scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court without an attorney.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEF states he received notice that Jamy Johanson is attorney, but hasn't been able to reach.
Court: directs DEF to keep calling PD atty, daily until reaches. If unable to reach by next wee, call PD office.
ADA Marcoux states he has an offer letter in the file.
Court: informs DEF he will need his attorney to speak with ADA regarding offer.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Case called.  
Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Jarvis: DEF didn't qualify for Public Defender and now does. Need to set s/c.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel. Not eligible for public defender.
ADA Marcoux: extends offer letter to DEF. Requests court for a sceduling conference for DEF to have time to read offer and speak with counsel.
Court allows. Bail continues.
  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Phillip John Metcalf in court.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  12:04 PM  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Defendant failed to appear yesterday.  State tendered complaint to defendant.  Court further addressed the defendant.  Court entered not guilty plea.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 11:00 am.
